Sustainability & Environmental Practices.question: What sustainable or environmental practices have been implemented?
Sustainability & Environmental Practices.result:
Through their business operations and offerings, this Canadian social enterprise has incorporated various sustainable and environmental practices. Some of these include:

1. Building ethical recycling ecosystems in vulnerable coastal communities, contributing to stopping ocean plastic and improving lives.
2. Reprocessing materials collected on beaches and near waterways for reintroduction into the global manufacturing supply chain.
3. Committing to removing three plastic bottles from coastlines for every 100ml of Oneka product purchased (whether online, at their store, or through retailers).
4. Encouraging customers to adopt eco-friendly habits, such as reducing plastic consumption, using refills instead of single-use containers, and bringing reusable bags and containers when shopping.
5. Providing free delivery for orders over $99 within Ontario and Quebec, and offering competitive rates for deliveries elsewhere in Canada and the US.
6. Promoting awareness of the "6Rs" and encouraging individuals to adopt additional sustainability practices beyond the traditional "reduce, reuse, recycle."

source.content: to offset our plastic consumption This Canadian social enterprise contributes to stopping ocean plastic and improves lives in ﻿vulnerable coastal communities by building ethical recycling ecosystems in countries like Haiti the Philippines Indonesia Brazil and Egypt To do so it reprocesses the materials collected on beaches and near waterways for reintroduction into the global manufacturing supply chain Collectors receive bonuses for the materials they collect which helps them provide basic family necessities such as groceries cooking fuel school tuition and health insurance﻿ Since  we have taken this collaboration further and we are now committed to having three plastic bottles removed from coastlines for every  ml of Oneka product purchased whether on our website at our store or through our retailers Thanks to this initiative in  we have together contributed to prevent the entry of 40 kg of plastic into our waterways outweighing our plastic consumption for that same year Plastic

containers Refills are one of the best ways to reduce your amount of plastic waste Another option is to buy a bulk bottle and share with your partner or family Our hand soap and body wash are the same formula so buy a bulk refill of one and fill up both containers Ask yourself Is it necessary Does the item use more energy than the benefit it brings Can I go without it Refuse products that you don’t need or that are bad for the environment If you’re getting take-out to eat at home remember to say you don’t need plastic utensils or straws Try to bring your own containers and bags to the grocery store or market and refuse to use single use options If you’re at a shop refuse the bag for items you buy if you can carry them or have your own bag Take it a step further if something comes packaged consider unpacking your item and asking the store to keep the extra packaging Though extreme this can send a clear message that packaging should be reduced Tip keep a set of cutlery a reusable straw

Sustainability & Environmental Practices.question: Are there any events or initiatives focused on environmental conservation? If yet then list 10 such events.
Sustainability & Environmental Practices.result: Yes, there are numerous events and initiatives focused on environmental conservation around the world. However, providing a comprehensive list of 10 such events would require extensive research and updates, which cannot be done within the scope of this platform. Instead, I recommend visiting websites like Earth Day Network, United Nations Environment Programme (UNEP), World Wildlife Fund (WWF), and Greenpeace, among others, to explore various events, campaigns, and projects related to environmental conservation. These organizations often host or collaborate on events throughout the year, aimed at promoting awareness, action, and policy change to address pressing environmental issues.

Sustainability & Environmental Practices.question: What environmental impact metrics are reported?
Sustainability & Environmental Practices.result: Based on the provided information, two main environmental impact metrics are mentioned: "Plastic Ratio" and "Chemical Ingredients Used." These metrics help measure the reduction of plastic usage and the transition towards more sustainable alternatives in terms of both ingredients and packaging materials. Additionally, the company mentions collaborating with another organization to remove plastic bottles from coastlines, demonstrating their commitment to addressing plastic waste and its impact on the environment.

source.content: to offset reduce and make its consumption more eco-responsible Since our beginnings we have taken numerous conscious decisions to try and be part of the solution rather than the problem Selling our products in bulk and setting up partnerships to prevent ocean plastic for example In order to make our activities as respectful of the Living as possible we want to go further in the fight against plastic pollution As PlasticFreeJuly is taking place discover our commitments and the innovations we are working on to achieve this goal Before thinking about reusing recycling composting or offsetting the first step is to reduce our use of plastic and more specifically single-use plastic right at the source The measurement we use to assess this regression is called the “plastic ratio” It is calculated by dividing the weight of plastic we used by the weight of products sold during a year Lowering this number is a challenge as most of our products are liquid and must be put in containers To achieve

Corporate Responsibility & Commitments.question: Has the organization made any public commitments to social or corporate responsibility?
Corporate Responsibility & Commitments.result: Yes, the organization has made several public commitments to social and corporate responsibility. They have pledged to collaborate with vulnerable coastal communities to create ethical recycling ecosystems, remove plastic bottles from coastlines, and support collectors who use bonus payments to meet their families' needs. Additionally, they aim to reduce their own plastic consumption while encouraging others to do the same. These commitments demonstrate the organization's dedication to addressing pressing environmental issues and promoting a more sustainable and equitable future.

Corporate Responsibility & Commitments.result: Based on the provided information, it seems that the organizer(s) of the Break the Ice Challenge Season 2 have decided not to participate in social media during the challenge season due to their personal beliefs and values. However, they still encourage their community to engage in activities that may push them out of their comfort zones. These challenges could potentially include trying new hobbies, exploring discomfort, and embracing vulnerability. Although specific community or social events related to these commitments were not mentioned, the overall message conveyed by the organizers suggests that participants might create their own gatherings or share their experiences on social media using designated hashtags or platforms.

Commerce & Products.question: What products, services, or technologies are available?
Commerce & Products.result:
Based on the given text, there are several products, services, and technologies mentioned. Some key points include:

1. Health News Site Developments - Periodic updates about new product releases, health news site improvements, and other relevant information.
2. Mailing List - Users can opt-in or out of receiving periodic emails regarding health news site developments, new product availability, and other related information.
3. Surveys & Contests - Occasionally, users may be asked to participate in surveys or contests, which are entirely voluntary.
4. Product Order Processing - When making purchases on the website, personal information might be used for commercial transactions involving companies involved in those transactions (e.g., shippers, couriers, credit card companies, and banks).
5. Website Analytics - Technical information is collected from web browsers or internet devices when visitors access www.onekaelements.com. This data helps track website usage patterns, page visits, operating systems, preferred web browsers, referring websites, and keyword searches.
6. Privacy Policy Commitment - Oneka Elements commits to protecting customer information and only discloses it if required by law or upon customer consent.
7. Sustainable Packaging Initiatives - Oneka Elements is exploring alternatives to traditional plastic packaging, such as using recycled materials, developing compostable, biodegradable, or solid product lines. They have already introduced some sustainable packaging solutions like soap bars made from plants sourced from their gardens. Additionally, they are working on expanding their solid product line and planning to release new bar products soon.
8. Environmental Impact Reduction - To mitigate their environmental impact, Oneka Elements has partnered with Plastic Bank since 202. This partnership supports the effort to stop ocean plastic and improve lives in vulnerable coastal communities by creating ethical recycling ecosystems.

Commerce & Products.question: What are the key partnerships or collaborations related to commerce?
Commerce & Products.result:
The key partnerships or collaborations related to commerce mentioned in the text include:

1. A Canadian social enterprise working together with vulnerable coastal communities to create ethical recycling ecosystems in countries like Haiti, the Philippines, Indonesia, Brazil, and Egypt. These efforts aim to stop ocean plastic and improve lives while also contributing to the global manufacturing supply chain.
2. Oneka Farm, where Teprine grows some of her family's food and works towards preserving and protecting heirloom plants and seeds. Through this collaboration, both Oneka and Le Noyau share a commitment to being stewards of the land and supporting biodiversity.

Employment & Opportunities.question: What employment or educational opportunities are currently available?
Employment & Opportunities.result: Based on the text provided, there aren't any explicit employment or educational opportunities mentioned. However, Teprine, who is featured in the text, seems to be involved in various activities related to agriculture, biodiversity, and seed conservation. Her work includes growing organic seeds, selling them to the local community, and sharing her knowledge with others. Additionally, Ecoterre Distribution mentions providing health news updates through their mailing list. While none of these directly offer job or learning opportunities, they showcase the diverse range of activities happening within the community focused on promoting a more inclusive and sustainable economy.

about the work of seed savers like Teprine because as just explained above it is of the utmost and critical importance So we asked her  How do you support biodiversity in your work as a farmer and entrepreneur  As a mother and a farmer I make a point of growing the seeds for the food we love to eat what we use in the kitchen to prepare meals As a seed saver and entrepreneur a lot of my work consists in building relationships with growers to raise their awareness about their role in the process of collecting seeds biodiversity and a part of their food sovereignty  On my land I work at preserving indigenous species of plants as such I follow a specific set of scientific guidelines so these plants' purity can be intact and protected I work as a keeper of the local and international plant genome heritage  It is very important to me to share and spread like seeds the knowledge I have acquired over the years alongside my esteemed mentors If we want more people to have access to nutritious

the Oneka farm There she grows some of her family's food and works at saving and protecting heirloom plants and seeds some of which are indigenous to the area and some come from other places in the world Teprine sells her organic seeds to the local community of growers and gardeners seasoned and new She is a nurturer and a transmitter of knowledge She is passionate to share what she has learnt over the years so that as many people as possible connect reconnect with the soil the joy and sense of purpose of growing their food and their garden  Some of the calendula and sage used in the Oneka products formula is grown from Le Noyau seeds Oneka and Le Noyau share a love and connection to the Living and most importantly they support each other in what they are called to do which is being keepers and stewards of the land  This mission is paramount in their collaboration One way of protecting and regenerating de land they were entrusted with is to support biodiversity Diversity of plants and

Free delivery from 99 Ontario and Quebec and  for the rest of Canada and the United States Today  million tons of plastic waste are produced each year 1 Of this colossal quantity only 9 is recycled and 12 incinerated The remaining 79 ends up in landfills or in the environment 2 where it never truly disappears but rather breaks down into smaller and smaller pieces called microplastics Not only are these tiny particles polluting our soil and water but they even enter the human body and accumulate in our organs 3 Plastic pollution is a threat to our planet’s health to the human health It simply cannot be ignored and requires systemic changes As a company that seeks to be truly sustainable and regenerative - and that uses plastic - we believe it is our responsibility to put in place measures to offset reduce and make its consumption more eco-responsible Since our beginnings we have taken numerous conscious decisions to try and be part of the solution rather than the problem Selling our

and stewards of the land  This mission is paramount in their collaboration One way of protecting and regenerating de land they were entrusted with is to support biodiversity Diversity of plants and animals is very important It makes living things adaptable It allows wild and domesticated species to withstand threats like diseases climate changes pests and other unpredictable conditions With enough variation in a group there will always be some individuals that are naturally suited to survive and can thrive under any changing situation  Food biodiversity is a key ingredient in creating a secure and sustainable food system Diversity in plants also gives us a treasure chest of options for raising the healthiest and most productive crops No matter what changes happen in our food system we will always be able to adapt if we have enough genetic diversity  The problem is that plant genetic diversity is disappearing Fast Like the erosion of a building's foundation this genetic erosion

to offset our plastic consumption This Canadian social enterprise contributes to stopping ocean plastic and improves lives in ﻿vulnerable coastal communities by building ethical recycling ecosystems in countries like Haiti the Philippines Indonesia Brazil and Egypt To do so it reprocesses the materials collected on beaches and near waterways for reintroduction into the global manufacturing supply chain Collectors receive bonuses for the materials they collect which helps them provide basic family necessities such as groceries cooking fuel school tuition and health insurance﻿ Since  we have taken this collaboration further and we are now committed to having three plastic bottles removed from coastlines for every  ml of Oneka product purchased whether on our website at our store or through our retailers Thanks to this initiative in  we have together contributed to prevent the entry of 40 kg of plastic into our waterways outweighing our plastic consumption for that same year Plastic

Collaboration & Partnerships.question: What organizations, institutions, or entities is the organization collaborating with?
Collaboration & Partnerships.result:
The organization is working closely with several key players in different fields. They include:

1. Oneka Farm - A farm where some of the family's food is grown, and efforts are made to save and protect heirloom plants and seeds.
2. Teprine - An organic seed supplier who sells seeds to local growers and gardeners, including those grown from Le Noyau seeds.
3. Le Noyau - Another entity that shares a common goal of preserving and caring for the land. Together, these three organizations work towards maintaining biodiversity and supporting each other in their missions.

Collaboration & Partnerships.question: What are the mutual objectives and outcomes expected from these collaborations?
Collaboration & Partnerships.result:
Through their collaborative efforts, the businesses aim to achieve several shared goals related to success, sustainability, and stewardship of the land. Some of the desired outcomes include:

1. Promoting a "best for the world" mindset among businesses, encouraging them to prioritize social and environmental impact alongside financial performance.
2. Building a more inclusive and equitable economy by supporting diverse business models and fostering partnerships between different stakeholders.
3. Protecting and regenerating the land through initiatives that support biodiversity, including plant and animal species diversity.
4. Ensuring long-term food security and resilience in the face of environmental challenges by promoting food biodiversity and genetic diversity within crop populations.
5. Strengthening local growing and seed-saving communities to expand education and resources available for individuals interested in sustainable agriculture practices.
6. Encouraging individual action towards supporting biodiversity and sustainability in home gardening and food systems.
7. Raising awareness about the interdependence of humans and nature, emphasizing the need for responsible consumption and production practices.
8. Preserving and protecting the global plant genome heritage by conserving and sharing indigenous plant species and their genetic information.

source.content: to redefine success in business and build a more inclusive and sustainable economyWe are happy and proud to be part of a business community whose business models drive them to be not the best IN the world but the best FOR the world Read more about our certifications HERE

and stewards of the land  This mission is paramount in their collaboration One way of protecting and regenerating de land they were entrusted with is to support biodiversity Diversity of plants and animals is very important It makes living things adaptable It allows wild and domesticated species to withstand threats like diseases climate changes pests and other unpredictable conditions With enough variation in a group there will always be some individuals that are naturally suited to survive and can thrive under any changing situation  Food biodiversity is a key ingredient in creating a secure and sustainable food system Diversity in plants also gives us a treasure chest of options for raising the healthiest and most productive crops No matter what changes happen in our food system we will always be able to adapt if we have enough genetic diversity  The problem is that plant genetic diversity is disappearing Fast Like the erosion of a building's foundation this genetic erosion

heritage  It is very important to me to share and spread like seeds the knowledge I have acquired over the years alongside my esteemed mentors If we want more people to have access to nutritious foods there needs to be more individuals doing what I do That is why the building of local growing and seed saving communities is so important to inspire support each other in our mission for common good  Spring is here a lot of us are getting busy seeding transplanting planting in our kitchens green houses gardens court yards balconies etc   So we asked Teprine what can each of us do to go in the right direction and support biodiversity while gardening  Working and talking with Teprine has been yet another opportunity to witness our interdependency with nature and its elements We are not above it we are not separate from it but part of it  When paying more attention to our food ecosystems we are faced with uncomfortable facts with choices to make but in this process we are given the chance to

about the work of seed savers like Teprine because as just explained above it is of the utmost and critical importance So we asked her  How do you support biodiversity in your work as a farmer and entrepreneur  As a mother and a farmer I make a point of growing the seeds for the food we love to eat what we use in the kitchen to prepare meals As a seed saver and entrepreneur a lot of my work consists in building relationships with growers to raise their awareness about their role in the process of collecting seeds biodiversity and a part of their food sovereignty  On my land I work at preserving indigenous species of plants as such I follow a specific set of scientific guidelines so these plants' purity can be intact and protected I work as a keeper of the local and international plant genome heritage  It is very important to me to share and spread like seeds the knowledge I have acquired over the years alongside my esteemed mentors If we want more people to have access to nutritious
